interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Farmer's Wife: A David Sutherland Film
Review Date: 2020/12/29
Categories: Talk Show and Variety
Product Description: ["Step inside the passionate, troubled lives of Juanita and Darrel Buschkoetter as they cling to family and farm. Called a “masterpiece,” “epic,” “compelling,” “extraordinary,” and a “triumphant film” by media critics, THE FARMER'S WIFE eloquently blends harsh American farm life with the bittersweet drama of modern marriage."]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Sutherland'], 'Producers': ['James Yee', 'Michael Sullivan', 'David Fanning', 'David Sutherland']}
Review Text: I cry over this story, as it resembled my own story.  How often was I called a sow, a pig, a heffer before I said, NO MORE - after 34 years, he still counts the years I am gone.  But sometimes - you learn to act a monster and the men laugh - but you cry at night for what you lost. Ain't no joke in abusive marriages or suffering or telling someone who washes your dirty clothes - there's the door, my way or the highway.  Sometimes, they may just take you up on your offer.  See Ya!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Review Title: A true real life view of a farm couple and how it really rolls
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

["From hitmaker Chuck Lorre comes his next big comedy – an irreverent and outrageous take on true family love – and dysfunction. Newly sober single mom Christy struggles to raise two children in a world full of temptations and pitfalls. Testing her sobriety is her formerly estranged mother, now back in Christy's life and eager to share passive-aggressive insights into her daughter's many mistakes."]

The Comeback is one of my favorite series
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Kyle Saylors'], 'Producers': ['Kenny Saylors', 'Norman Pardo'], 'Starring': ['O.J. Simpson', 'Norman Pardo', 'Wendy Williams']}
I actually found this interesting and perspective as to the dealings and sealing of evidence that has never been turned over or opened by Garcetti.  - interesting investigation sealings - interesting relationships exposed.  It was a perspective from a man that was inside and these facts never came up in the media reports.  The man doing life, Danny Wacsz I think was his name and his letter.  The relationships between Nicole and Kris Kardashian-Jenner and the friendship between Kardashian and OJ.  Very informative details bravely told.  What does it all mean, not much.  But it was worth watching, I fell asleep during it as it was sort of repeating itself and somewhat disconnecting so that a few details could be made long enough to drag into a movie length.  I don't think Kardashian should have been able to use his legal license to prevent questions due to the length of his license being inactive and his close relationship with OJ and the fact that he had been accused of hiring a hitman for OJ to kill Nicole.  Also the information that Kris had a long running open marriage with sexual relationships with OJ - has this even been proven?  But it did explain why people keep saying Khloe is OJ's child. I had not heard this before that there was cross overs in the pairs, I guess they call it "swinging"; but during the time that type as is today, very popular among couples so it's not unbelievable, it is just information that probably unless you were in the room, can't be verified.  Given that young Rob Kardashian has texted about his ability to take down others, and has been sued for threats founded or unfounded??? through various groups it does raise brows to question the dynamics of this family's history.  Whatever the case, Nicole and Ron are deceased and I hope they are at peace in their souls and whomever was responsible has to live with it forever.  Drugs were involved, that was made clear and dangerous criminal types and anger, rage and jealousy.  Never a winning recipe.
Interesting details never before told

profile:
User Profile Summary:

- **Rating Trends**: The user exhibits a keen appreciation for impactful storytelling, recently awarding a high rating to a film that delves deeply into the complexities of personal struggles within a farming backdrop. Their discerning taste continues to seek out nuanced narratives that resonate on a personal level.

- **Content Preferences**: The user's inclination toward intricate narratives and adult themes remains strong, particularly those portraying authentic, challenging personal and social issues. They appreciate realistic depictions that inspire profound discussions about difficult topics.

- **Emotional Connection**: Displaying a powerful emotional engagement with media, the user often relates personally to the content, especially when it reflects experiences of hardship, resilience, and authenticity. They express a strong aversion to superficial portrayals, underscoring their demand for depth.

- **Language and Accessibility**: The preference for English audio continues, showcasing their focus on clarity and accessibility while being open to English subtitles when necessary.

- **Creative Involvement**: The user actively engages with works by skilled filmmakers, demonstrating interest in the intricate dynamics of human relationships portrayed across various narratives.

- **Customization Preferences**: They remain dedicated to finding content that seamlessly blends entertainment with significant thematic exploration, maintaining a critical perspective on both narrative and humor concerning complex social issues.

Overall, the user seeks emotionally resonant media that champions depth and authenticity while remaining open to exploring provocative themes and personal stories.
